newsitem.title: FRANCE: Dominique Bazy quits French insurer Axa.
newsitem.headline: Dominique Bazy quits French insurer Axa.

text.p: Dominique Bazy, senior executive vice president in the new merged Axa-UAP French insurance group, has resigned, Axa said on Monday.
Bazy joined Axa from UAP after the merger deal was struck late last year. Bazy, who was chairman of UAP France, had been regarded as one of UAP's most able senior executives.
Bazy, who was a member of Axa's executive committee, "chose to leave the Axa group because he wished to have more operational responsabilities," Axa said in a statement.
It did not say what Bazy's future plans were.
Axa said a replacement for Bazy would be appointed within the next two weeks.
Bazy was principal shareholder representative for insurance operations in all countries except France, the United States and life operations in Britain.
The merger between Axa and Union des Assurances de Paris created the world's second largest insurance group.
